newsitem.title: USA: DT Industries completes Hansford purchase.
newsitem.headline: DT Industries completes Hansford purchase.

text.p: DT Industries Inc said Tuesday it completed the acquisition of Hansford Manufacturing Corp of Rochester, N.Y., for $17.4 million.

DTI also agreed to make additional cash payments totaling up to $20 million, payable over a two-year period beginning in approximately three years. The amount would be determined by a formula based on the earnings of the acquired business.
Hansford is a privately-held designer and manufacturer of assembly automation systems.
For the first eight months of calendar 1996, Hansford recorded net sales of $33 million and an operating profit of $2.3 million. The backlog at September 30 was approximately $18 million.
DT Industries also announced that its credit facility increased to $210 million from $200 million.

"The acquisition of Hansford's advanced engineering and technological expertise adds a valued new dimension to our DT Automation group," Stephen Gore, president and chief executive officer, said in a statement.
DT makes and integrates automated production equipment to manufacture or package industrial and consumer products.
